intro: Columnea sanmartensis, commonly known as the San Martín flame plant, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its native habitat. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are slender and branching. Columnea sanmartensis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to thrive in shaded, humid environments.
